data.title: Şehzade Mehmet Mosque
data.meta_description: Süleyman the Magnificent built this square-shaped mosque between 1543 and 1548 as a memorial to his son Mehmet, who died of smallpox in 1543 at the age of…
data.text:
Hagia Sophia Grand Mosque

1.22 MILES

Right in the heart of İstanbul’s historic center, this sacred Byzantine building remains an important symbol of power.

Topkapı Palace

1.38 MILES

1.54 MILES

Süleymaniye Mosque

0.38 MILES

The Süleymaniye crowns one of İstanbul's seven hills and dominates the Golden Horn, providing a landmark for the entire city. Though it's not the largest…

Blue Mosque

1.17 MILES

Grand Bazaar

0.6 MILES

1.58 MILES
